short-title.#text:
Reinvesting In Vital Economic Rivers
			 and Waterways Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
finds that the inland waterways
			 navigation system—

text.#text:
is an essential economic resource for the
			 United States;

serves as the most efficient sustainable
			 transportation mode for bulk commodities in the United States while maintaining
			 environmental resources; and

as of the date of enactment of this Act, is
			 underfunded and needs significant changes to remain viable in the
			 future.

The purpose of this Act is to establish a
			 sustainable, cost-effective way to ensure that the inland and intracoastal
			 waterways of the United States remain economically viable through—

the continued
			 development and improvement of inland waterways navigation systems;

inland waterways
			 navigation capital investments to ensure that projects can be completed in a
			 reasonable timeframe and to allow maximum systemwide benefits.
In this Act:

term.#tail:
means the inland and intracoastal waterways of the United
			 States described in

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 206 of the Inland Waterways Revenue Act of 1978

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: established by

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 302 of the Water
			 Resources Development Act of 1986

term.#tail:
means a project for the restoration of a major project or major
			 project feature of the inland and intracoastal waterways that has an estimated
			 cost greater than $50,000,000.

header.#text:

text.#text:
Amounts in the Inland
				Waterways Trust Fund shall not be available for expenditures for—

construction or rehabilitation of dams,

Amounts in the
